Batch Calculate Cronbach's Alpha for Multiple Scales

Source: R/psychometrics.R
alpha_table.Rd

Calculates Cronbach's alpha for multiple scales in a single call. Returns a tidy table with one row per scale.

Usage

alpha_table(data, scales_spec, method = c("internal", "performance", "psych"))

Arguments

data

Data frame containing all items

scales_spec

Named list where names are scale names and values are character vectors of item names. Example: list(satisfaction = c("sat1", "sat2", "sat3"), loyalty = c("loy1", "loy2"))

method

Character. Method to use: - "internal" (default): Use built-in calculate_alpha() - "performance": Use performance::cronbachs_alpha() if available - "psych": Use psych::alpha() if available

Value

A tibble with one row per scale containing:

  • scale_name: Name of the scale

  • alpha: Cronbach's alpha coefficient

  • n_items: Number of items in scale

  • n_obs: Number of complete observations

  • interpretation: Quality rating (Excellent/Good/Acceptable/etc.)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
scales <- list(
  satisfaction = c("sat1", "sat2", "sat3", "sat4"),
  loyalty = c("loy1", "loy2", "loy3"),
  value = c("val1", "val2", "val3", "val4", "val5")
)

alpha_results <- alpha_table(customer_data, scales)
print(alpha_results)
} # }
